channel.title: One question help please!
channel.description: I got idea to add one thing to my server. In runescape where are loyality points , u can buy like "lionheart PLAYERNAME" , "war-chief PLAYERNAME" so i wanted to ask how can i add something like that to my server PI?

item.title: One question help please!
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

A quick google search goes a long way… Search on google for loyalty titles runeserber (v)…

Read full topic

item.title: One question help please!
item.dc:creator: @David321 David321
item.description:
@David321 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:5, topic:427943”][code=Java]public enum LoyaltyTitle {
SIR(1000, “Sir”),
LORD(1000, “Lord”),
LIONHEART(4000, “Lionheart”),
HELLRAISER(8000, “Hellraiser”),
DESPERADO(10000, “Desperado”),
COUNT(15000, “Count”),
OVERLORD(15000, “Overlord”),
DUKE(20000, “Duke”),
KING(25000, “King”),
BIG_CHEESE(25000, “Big Chese”),
BIGWIG(25000, “Bigwig”),
WUNDERKIND(50000, “Wunderkind”);

private final int cost;
private final String text

private LoyaltyTitle(final int cost, final String text) {
    this.cost = cost;
    this.text = text;
}

public int getCost() {
    return cost;
}

public String getText() {
    return text;
}

}[/code][/quote]

which file?
If there would be “tons of tuts” i would already found it!

Read full topic

item.title: One question help please!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[code=Java]public enum LoyaltyTitle {
SIR(1000, “Sir”),
LORD(1000, “Lord”),
LIONHEART(4000, “Lionheart”),
HELLRAISER(8000, “Hellraiser”),
DESPERADO(10000, “Desperado”),
COUNT(15000, “Count”),
OVERLORD(15000, “Overlord”),
DUKE(20000, “Duke”),
KING(25000, “King”),
BIG_CHEESE(25000, “Big Chese”),
BIGWIG(25000, “Bigwig”),
WUNDERKIND(50000, “Wunderkind”);

private final int cost;
private final String text

private LoyaltyTitle(final int cost, final String text) {
    this.cost = cost;
    this.text = text;
}

public int getCost() {
    return cost;
}

public String getText() {
    return text;
}

}[/code]
